photo.description: Statues of Heavenly King and Vajrapani, Fengxian cave, at the Longmen Grottoes.
photo.tags: buddha buddhism buddhist cavetemple china grotto henan sculpture temple worldheritagesite
photo.title: Longmen Grottoes

photo.description: The Vairochana Buddha of Fengxian cave, the largest Buddha statue at the Longmen Grottoes. The other statues are of Kasyapa (on the left of Buddha) and Ananda (on the right), disciples of Buddha and two Bodhisattvas.
photo.tags: buddha buddhism buddhist cavetemple china grotto henan sculpture temple worldheritagesite
photo.title: Longmen Grottoes

photo.description: Statues of a Bodhisattva and Ananda, Fengxian cave, at the Longmen Grottoes.
photo.tags: buddha buddhism buddhist cavetemple china grotto henan sculpture temple worldheritagesite
photo.title: Longmen Grottoes

photo.description: 摘自维基百科： 龙门石窟是中国著名的三大石刻艺术宝库之一，位于河南省洛阳南郊12公里处的伊河两岸。经过自北魏至北宋400余年的开凿，至今仍存有窟龛2100多个，造像10万余尊，碑刻题记3600余品[1]，多在伊水西岸。数量之多位于中国各大石窟之首。其中“龙门二十品”是書法魏碑精华，唐代著名书法家褚遂良所书的“伊阙佛龛之碑”则是初唐楷书艺术的典范。 Quoted from Wikipedia: The Longmen Grottoes (ch. 龍門石窟/ 龙门石窟, lóngmén shíkū; lit. Dragon's Gate Grottoes) or Longmen Caves are located 12 km south of present day Luoyang in Henan province, China. The grottoes, which overwhelmingly depict Buddhist subjects, are densely dotted along the two mountains: Xiangshan (to the east) and Longmenshan (to the west). The Yi River flows northward between them. For this reason, the area used to be called Yique (The Gate of the Yi River). From north to south, the distance covered by grottoes is about one km. Along with the Mogao Caves and Yungang Grottoes, the Longmen Grottoes are one of the three most famous ancient sculptural sites in China.
photo.tags: nikon nikkor d80 henan luoyang longmen grottoes longmengrottoes 尼康 河南 洛阳 龙门石窟 石窟 heritagesite85 heritagesite101
photo.title: 洛阳龙门石窟 Longmen Grottoes

photo.tags: grotto henan longmen grottoes 龍門石窟 龙门石窟 china buddha
photo.title: Longmen Grottoes

photo.description: 摘自维基百科： 龙门石窟是中国著名的三大石刻艺术宝库之一，位于河南省洛阳南郊12公里处的伊河两岸。经过自北魏至北宋400余年的开凿，至今仍存有窟龛2100多个，造像10万余尊，碑刻题记3600余品[1]，多在伊水西岸。数量之多位于中国各大石窟之首。其中“龙门二十品”是書法魏碑精华，唐代著名书法家褚遂良所书的“伊阙佛龛之碑”则是初唐楷书艺术的典范。 Quoted from Wikipedia: The Longmen Grottoes (ch. 龍門石窟/ 龙门石窟, lóngmén shíkū; lit. Dragon's Gate Grottoes) or Longmen Caves are located 12 km south of present day Luoyang in Henan province, China. The grottoes, which overwhelmingly depict Buddhist subjects, are densely dotted along the two mountains: Xiangshan (to the east) and Longmenshan (to the west). The Yi River flows northward between them. For this reason, the area used to be called Yique (The Gate of the Yi River). From north to south, the distance covered by grottoes is about one km. Along with the Mogao Caves and Yungang Grottoes, the Longmen Grottoes are one of the three most famous ancient sculptural sites in China.
